Text: A few young Vermonters had some very important questions for Peter. https://t.co/591XzmGczd

In the face of this injustice, one thing we can do right now is support the groups providing resources where they're needed most. Donate to the National Network of Abortion Funds here: https://t.co/g5yWHTmCeO
Not only will I be fighting for the right to abortion in Congress, I'll be voting for Prop 5 this November, which will enshrine reproductive rights in Vermont's constitution.
Right now, we need to act by codifying the right to abortion so that all women can enjoy reproductive freedom no matter their zip code.

Overturning Roe sets this country back decades, and will immediately put the health of millions of people around the country at risk. This is the product of a decades-long plan led by Mitch McConnell to stack the court with anti-choice justices.

50 years ago, 37 words made it illegal to discriminate on the basis of sex in educational settings receiving federal funding. #TitleIX changed women's lives. But we still have a lot of work to do.

Here's to the first 50 years of progress, and the next 50 years of work.
Another example of a deliberate trend created by McConnell and Trump towards minority rule in this country.

This morning, six conservative Justices appointed by Republicans and serving life terms struck down a New York law passed by legislators trying to curb gun violence. The conservatives have shown again and again they are interested in protecting the powerful, not the people.
Every child should have access to a quality education.
They're a 10 but they don't believe in climate change.

It's been 4,715 days since the last federal minimum wage increase.

As we recognize Juneteenth, it's important that we reflect on and learn from our past. While we celebrate emancipation, we must recommit ourselves to the work of ending systemic racism, in order to deliver on our promise of equality.
Happy Father's Day to all the Dads and father figures out there!

More than three in four working people in Vermont don't have paid family leave through their jobs. That means people ‚Äî often women ‚Äî are forced to leave the workforce to take care of their family. 

Universal paid leave will close gender gaps and boost our economy.

Everyone in this country has the right to clean water, full stop. That's why I've supported legislation to address the "forever chemicals" pollution crisis and help clean up community water systems.

In the midst of renewed attacks on the LGBTQ+ community and surging gun violence, we must stand together against hate and pass laws that protect vulnerable communities and prevent gun violence.
There's no backup planet. We have to protect the one we've got.

With a Green New Deal, we can expand that number and create quality, stable jobs for the next generation, while protecting our planet.

I'm thankful for the opportunity to talk about the issues that matter most to Vermonters and to outline steps to address their concerns.

More than one-third of Vermont households are living in unaffordable housing ‚Äî with some paying 50% or more of their income.

That's unacceptable. We have to act now to make sure young Vermonters can invest in our state and live here for generations to come.

There have been 20 mass shootings since Uvalde. 

When will enough be enough?

This Memorial Day, we remember those who gave their lives serving their country in the armed forces. 

We honor them by continuing our work to support the loved ones they leave behind and ensuring veterans get the care and benefits they have earned.

Since Columbine, more than 311,000 students have experienced gun violence at school. A generation of young people are being raised in a society where school shootings are normal. 

We are failing them, and will continue to fail them until we pass gun violence prevention laws.

We‚Äôre condemned to relive this trauma and feeling of immeasurable loss over and over again, until we stand up to the gun lobby, abolish the filibuster, and pass comprehensive gun violence prevention legislation.
We live in a country where parents dropped their kids off at school this morning with a renewed sense of fear that it could be the last time they see them.
Voters should pick their leaders, not the other way around. Let's protect the right to vote.

Folks are feeling the weight of high prices and it's our job to help them out. Here are a few things I'm fighting for to lower the cost of living: 

üßí Access to affordable childcare
üíä Letting Medicare negotiate lower drug prices

In the face of unprecedented attacks on Roe v. Wade, I'm proud that Vermont is moving to amend the state's constitution to protect the right to choose. 

Reproductive rights are on the ballot this November, and I'll be voting for Prop 5.

Protecting the environment is at the heart of everything that we do in Vermont. 

Proud of @VermontGreenFC for upholding our state's values as they prepare for their first season.

It's cruel and extreme. 
We must keep fighting.

Now it's our turn in Congress to ensure equal work means equal pay for all Americans. https://t.co/XkIC7MLJtN
Some of the richest companies continue to outsource jobs overseas. We can create good, union jobs right here in America by passing the Green New Deal.

If we don't take action, we're resigning ourselves to more shootings, more terror, more deaths. 

We can pass gun violence prevention legislation and provide more funding for mental health services tomorrow if Republicans got on board. https://t.co/MruI4Tjk26

People remember Brown v. Board of Education, decided on this day in 1954, as a turning point for civil rights. But we must also remember that school integration efforts faced fierce resistance for decades after the decision. 

Justice doesn't just happen, we have to fight for it.

We must address gun violence and the rise of racism and anti-semitism in our country. Racist rhetoric from political leaders creates a culture of hate, and weak gun laws allow these extremists to access weapons of mass murder. We must act now, we can't let this keep happening.
Reproductive rights are human rights.

Vermont saw the highest number of opioid overdoses ever last year. Folks need help, and they need it now. 

That's why I've cosponsored legislation to provide funding for treatment and recovery services. I won't stop fighting until we get this done.
https://t.co/zfXv6g5w5N
I joined the #BansOffOurBodies rally in Montpelier today to demand protections for abortion rights. We won't back down. https://t.co/XVMqMcgVKe

America doesn't guarantee paid leave, we don't have universal child care, and we're facing a baby formula shortage.  

We need to start supporting working families instead of corporate special interests.

When I graduated law school, I had the chance to work on Wall Street or K Street. 

Instead, I decided to work on Bridge Street in White River Junction as a public defender.

Firefighters put themselves in danger everyday, and they do it to keep our communities safe.

That's why I cosponsored and helped pass the Federal Firefighters Fairness Act, which ensures they get the health care and support they need when injured on the job.

The entire Senate Republican caucus voted against the Women's Health Protection Act today, and they won't stop there - they have their sights set on a nationwide ban.

If elected to the Senate, I'll vote for reproductive freedom - every single time. 

We can't go back.
Let's lower the cost of insulin.

This is a moment I hoped we'd never see, but it's here. I'm running for Senate because the right to an abortion is fundamental and non-negotiable. 

I refuse to let Vermont be the seat that gives Mitch McConnell control and lets him pass a nationwide ban. https://t.co/jjCt61e3x8

SCOTUS is poised to overturn Roe and Mitch McConnell is signaling the GOP could pursue a nationwide abortion ban.

Reproductive freedom is on the ballot this November.

Voting restrictions disproportionately impact people of color. And that's the point. Leaders should win elections by convincing the most voters of their vision, not by picking which people get to vote at all.

Pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Act.

The climate crisis is an existential threat. This isn't a problem to deal with in the future, it's a problem right now. Heat waves and wildfires are more common, temperatures and sea levels are rising, habitats are disappearing.

We need bold action now, we need a Green New Deal.

I love serving our state bc I get the opportunity to connect with so many passionate Vermonters. I've talked with voters who agree with me & voters who disagree with me. At the end of the day, they all care about their communities.

I care too, that's why I'm running for Senate.

The wave of union victories across the country shows that workers are fed up watching CEO pay skyrocket while their pay stays the same ‚Äî and they're doing something about it.

Congress should be fighting for workers too. Let's strengthen labor laws and raise the minimum wage.

I've supported gun violence prevention in the House, and will do so in the Senate.

As we work to get our economy back on track, we must ensure the most vulnerable are part of our recovery.
